vectorData.altText: 5. Identify the structure indicated. Begin your answer with “right” or “left”.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That's right! It’s the left primary bronchus.
and follow it inferiorly to its bifurcation at the level of the sternal angle. Identify the right and left primary bronchi. Notice that the right

primary bronchus is larger in diameter, more vertically oriented and shorter than the left primary bronchus. 
This is because the left lung is farther from the midline than the right, meaning that he left primary bronchus must travel farther to meet the hilum of the left lung.
arches over the right primary bronchus, while the aorta arches over the left primary bronchus.
front and back, at its point of bifurcation. Observe that tracheal cartilages are C-shaped, and open posteriorly toward the esophagus.
